channel.title: NPR Topics: Culture
channel.description: Art and entertainment commentary plus interviews, book reviews, movie reviews, music reviews, comedy, and visual art. Subscribe to podcasts and follow trends in music, painting, art, architecture, photography, and design.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Here's what made it onto this year's UNESCO intangible cultural heritage list
item.description: Each year, UNESCO recognizes culturally significant practices, traditions and customs. 2025's list includes weaving, handmade paper craftsmanship, yurt making, a genre of Cuban music and yodeling.
item.content:encoded: Each year, UNESCO recognizes culturally significant practices, traditions and customs. 2025's list includes weaving, handmade paper craftsmanship, yurt making, a genre of Cuban music and yodeling.
item.dc:creator: Avery Keatley

item.title: Actor Jamie Lee Curtis talks about accepting the realities of growing older
item.description: On Wild Card, well-known guests answer the kinds of questions we often think about but don't talk about. Actor Jamie Lee Curtis talks about accepting the realities of growing older.
item.content:encoded: On Wild Card, well-known guests answer the kinds of questions we often think about but don't talk about. Actor Jamie Lee Curtis talks about accepting the realities of growing older.

item.title: Chop suey, a holiday classic for generations, is a dish of rich origins
item.description: Before its fall from grace, the Chinese-American dish chop suey was a holiday tradition for families who don't celebrate Christmas, even being immortalized in songs and film.
item.content:encoded: Before its fall from grace, the Chinese-American dish chop suey was a holiday tradition for families who don't celebrate Christmas, even being immortalized in songs and film.
item.dc:creator: Neda Ulaby

item.title: Forget flowers: These ancient plants attract pollinators by getting hot
item.description: While many modern plants use colorful flowers to attract pollinators, ancient palm-like plants called cycads lure them by heating up and glowing in the infrared.
item.content:encoded:
While many modern plants use colorful flowers to attract pollinators, ancient palm-like plants called cycads lure them by heating up and glowing in the infrared.

(Image credit: Michael Calonje)
item.dc:creator: Nell Greenfieldboyce

item.title: Billion-dollar OpenAI deal allows users to make content with Disney characters
item.description: It's a whole new world for Mickey, Simba, Stitch and more as Disney brings hundreds of its characters to Sora, the short-form video platform from OpenAI, as part of a three-year licensing agreement.
item.content:encoded:
It's a whole new world for Mickey, Simba, Stitch and more as Disney brings hundreds of its characters to Sora, the short-form video platform from OpenAI, as part of a three-year licensing agreement.

(Image credit: Disney)
item.dc:creator: Andrew Limbong

item.title: Was Michael Jordan NBA's GOAT? Phil Jackson reflects on the 'Masters of the Game'
item.description: Legendary NBA head coach Phil Jackson and sports writer Sam Smith talk about the stars who helped define the sport, including Jordan, Kobe, Shaq and "bad boy" Dennis Rodman.
item.content:encoded:
Legendary NBA head coach Phil Jackson and sports writer Sam Smith talk about the stars who helped define the sport, including Jordan, Kobe, Shaq and "bad boy" Dennis Rodman.

(Image credit: Jeff Haynes)
item.dc:creator: Tonya Mosley

item.title: These 10 terrific movies emerged from a tumultuous year for the film industry
item.description: Fresh Air film critic Justin Chang says most of his favorite films this year were made overseas, including his No. 1 pick, Sirāt.
item.content:encoded: Fresh Air film critic Justin Chang says most of his favorite films this year were made overseas, including his No. 1 pick, Sirāt.
item.dc:creator: Justin Chang

item.title: Feast your eyes on these 10 cookbooks from 2025
item.description: Whether you're craving something sweet, savory, spicy — or all of the above in one flavorful meal — we've got you covered. Here are 10 favorite cookbooks from the past year.
item.content:encoded: Whether you're craving something sweet, savory, spicy — or all of the above in one flavorful meal — we've got you covered. Here are 10 favorite cookbooks from the past year.
item.dc:creator: Ivy Buck

item.title: A political dramedy, military satire, and dark whimsy — in theaters this week
item.description: James L. Brooks' first feature film in 15 years doesn't live up to expectations.
item.content:encoded:
James L. Brooks' first feature film in 15 years doesn't live up to expectations.

(Image credit: Claire Folger)
item.dc:creator: Bob Mondello

item.title: Dick Van Dyke is turning 100! Here's how he danced into our lives
item.description: In a matter of a few years in the 1960s, Dick Van Dyke became a star on Broadway, television and the silver screen.
item.content:encoded: In a matter of a few years in the 1960s, Dick Van Dyke became a star on Broadway, television and the silver screen.
item.dc:creator: Bob Mondello
